chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles Robert Donald was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years of the term of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars or liquor stores, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Fine/Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan. Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the Fine/Costs.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Robert Donald

records.addlTxt: Cases 22CF64 & 22TR523 called @ 11:15 AM Defendant Charles Robert Donald in court, in custody.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Charles Robert Donald.  Attorney Tucker Tollefson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Count 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Count 1 - DRI, Count 3 - Dismissed Outright, 22TR523 - Dismissed Outright. Sentencing argument by Atty Tollefson. Sentencing argument by Atty Sheets. No statement by DE. Court orders: 8 years prison, bifurcated sentence. 4 years IC/4 years ES, 177 days CFTS. ES Conditions: Lifetime DL revocation. 36 month IID. OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars or liquor stores, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. $3,000 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
